title: Repealing the Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Act No.2 of 1996
decision_details: - The Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Act, No.2 of 1996 has been amended 08 times so far, and steps have been taken on several occasions to repeal the said Act and introduce a new Act, but the said task has not been concluded yet. In order to strengthen the legislative framework on the issues related to illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing operations in the country's territorial waters and as well as on the high seas, a preliminary draft has been prepared by a Committee comprising of officials of the Ministry of Fisheries, as well as officials of the Legal Draftsman's Department, the Attorney General's Department and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs with the technical assistance of the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations as well. The proposal made by the Minister of Fisheries, Aquatic and Ocean Resources to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a new Bill, based on the said preliminary draft, was approved by the Cabinet.
